info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 18 at 5:05PM PDT by NWS Portland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Clackamas County through 530 PM PDT... At 504 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Boring, or 7 miles northeast of Oregon City, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Gladstone, Boring, Oatfield, Clackamas, Happy Valley, Damascus, Johnson City, Eagle Creek and Sunnyside. This includes the following highways in Oregon... Interstate 205 between mile markers 12 and 14. U.S. Highway 26 east of Portland between mile markers 17 and 20. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Conditions are favorable for the development of weak, brief funnel clouds. This type of funnel cloud is harmless, but on rare occasions they can briefly touch down, producing wind gusts over 50 mph. If a funnel cloud is spotted move indoors and report your sighting to the National Weather Service. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
